title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.001
frontText: What are the default values for these instance variables: String s; int num; boolean b; double d?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.002
frontText: What characters may a variable name end with?
backText: A letter, number, currency symbol ($), or underscore (_)

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.003
frontText: The bytecode for a class named Hello in the a.b.c package must appear in what directory structure?
backText: The file Hello.class must be in the subdirectory a/b/c.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.004
frontText: What is the most common signature of a main() method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.005
frontText: Fill in the blank: An instance of a class is called a(n) _________________.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.006
frontText: What is the command line used to compile the Java class Wolf.java in the default package, and what file does it generate?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.007
frontText: What are the three valid formats for comments?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.008
frontText: What does JAR stand for?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.009
frontText: var can be used as the type for which of the following: instance variable, static variable, local variable, constructor parameter, method parameter?
backText: var can be used only as a local variable.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.010
frontText: Besides letters and numbers, what symbols are permitted to be used in identifiers?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.011
frontText: True or false? Garbage collection is guaranteed to run at a fixed schedule and when the JVM is low on memory.
backText: False. The JVM controls when garbage collection is run, and when it occurs is not guaranteed.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.012
frontText: What is the syntax for creating an instance initializer?
backText: {} with zero or more statements inside the block

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.013
frontText: Name the eight Java primitive types and indicate which are integer types, which are floating‐point types, and which are neither, in increasing order of size.
backText: In increasing order of size for each group: byte, short, char, int, and long are integer types; float and double are floating‐point types; and boolean is neither.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.014
frontText: What is a redundant package import?
backText: A package import that is unnecessary. Removing the import does not prevent the code from compiling.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.015
frontText: What are the names of the options available to set a classpath in a java or javac command?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.016
frontText: True or false? If a text block ends with gerbil""", a new line is added.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.017
frontText: What character is used in a text block to avoid a line break?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.018
frontText: What wrapper class goes with int?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.019
frontText: Rank these operators from highest operator precedence to lowest: + (addition) * ! == ++

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.020
frontText: True or false? The logical complement operator, -, flips the value of a boolean expression.
backText: False. The logical complement operator is !.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.021
frontText: Which operator can be used to avoid cast exceptions at runtime?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.022
frontText: Which of the following requires an explicit cast to be assigned to a short value? int, byte, float, bit
backText: int and float require an explicit cast, while byte does not. Note that bit is not a primitive type in Java.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.023
frontText: What is the data type of z? short x = 20; var z = x + 10

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.024
frontText: Either of which two complementary operators can be used to test if x is greater than or equal to y?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.025
frontText: Besides itself, which numeric primitive types can be implicitly cast to double?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.026
frontText: What is the output of (true ? false : 4 ? 5 : 6)?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.027
frontText: What is the value of 10 % 3 and 10 / 3?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.028
frontText: True or false? All operators are evaluated from left to right.
backText: False. The assignment operator is evaluated from right to left.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.029
frontText: How many operators in Java take three values?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.030
frontText: True or false? Unary operators have the highest order of precedence.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.031
frontText: What is an unperformed side effect?
backText: An expression that could modify a variable but is never executed because of a short‐circuit operation

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.032
frontText: What is operator precedence?
backText: Some operators have higher precedence and therefore are executed before other operators when reading from left to right.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.033
frontText: Without using any variables, what could you write to negate the value -5?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.034
frontText: Which operator increments a value and returns the original value?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.035
frontText: Given p q, where both p and q are true expressions, which side will not be evaluated at runtime?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.036
frontText: True or false? An if statement can have one or more associated else statements.
backText: False. An if statement can have at most one associated else statement.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.037
frontText: Name the data types supported by a switch statement.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.038
frontText: Which data types are supported as the target of an if statement’s conditional clause?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.039
frontText: True or false? A case statement can use effectively final variables.
backText: False. The variables must be compile‐time constants. Unlike effectively final variables, a compile‐time constant must be explicitly marked final and be initialized in the line where it is declared.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.040
frontText: Which looping statement guarantees that the body is executed at least once?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.041
frontText: What are acceptable data types on the right‐hand side of a for‐each loop?
backText: A built‐in array or class that implements java.lang.Iterable

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.042
frontText: Which statement can be used to stop the current loop execution and immediately evaluate the loop condition?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.043
frontText: True or false? Nested loops can only be used with for loops.
backText: False. Other types of loops, such as while and do while, can be used as nested loops.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.044
frontText: What is the purpose of a label statement?
backText: It allows the program to break or continue for a specific loop within a group of nested loops.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.045
frontText: What is flow scoping?
backText: Flow scoping means the variable is only in scope when the compiler can definitively determine its type.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.046
frontText: What is the difference between a switch statement and switch expression?
backText: A switch expression is a compact form of a switch statement that uses the arrow operator (->) and is capable of returning a value.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.047
frontText: What is unreachable code?
backText: Any lines of code that the compiler determines it is not possible to reach at runtime

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.048
frontText: When performing pattern matching, which operator is primarily used?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.049
frontText: True or false? A switch expression is always required to have a default statement when assigning the result to an int value.
backText: True, since handling every possible int value would be untenable.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.050
frontText: Which operator or statement can be used to combine case values within a switch statement?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.051
frontText: What is a compile‐time constant variable?
backText: A variable that is marked final and initialized with a literal value when it is declared

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.052
frontText: Write a for‐each loop that iterates over an int[] data in reverse.
backText: Trick question. For‐each loops cannot be used to iterate over a data structure in reverse order.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.053
frontText: True or false? Pattern matching allows you to avoid performing a separate cast operator.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.054
frontText: When calling the String.format() method, what is the meaning of the symbols %05.2f?
backText: They will display a floating‐point number as five digits, with leading 0s, rounding to two digits after the decimal.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.055
frontText: What does this code print? String s = "hmm"; System.out.println(s.substring(1, 2));
backText: m. The substring starts with the character at index 1 (m) and ends with the character before index 2.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.056
frontText: Fill in the blank: _____ is used to reliably check if two String values are the same.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.057
frontText: How many objects are created in String[] s = new String[5];?
backText: Just one. The references are all set to null by default.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.058
frontText: What does the following output? int[] x = { 7, 8, 9}; int[] y = { 7, 7, 7}; System.out.println(Arrays.compare(x, y) + " " + Arrays.mismatch(x, y));

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.059
frontText: What String method returns the position of a value in a String?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.060
frontText: What does the following expression return? new StringBuilder("Hello").equals("Hello")
backText: false, as they are not the same object type

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.061
frontText: Write a statement to create a two‐dimensional primitive integer array initialized with the values [1 2] [3 4].

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.062
frontText: What String method converts \\\\\\\\n to the new line escape character?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.063
frontText: True or false? indent(x) can take positive or negative integers as a parameter.
backText: True. Negative integers will remove leading whitespace.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.064
frontText: True or false? Math.round() returns the same primitive type it is passed.
backText: False. It returns int/long when passed float/double, respectively.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.065
frontText: Does Duration or Period support hours?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.066
frontText: What represents a specific moment in time in GMT?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.067
frontText: What methods can remove whitespace from the end of a String ?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.068
frontText: True or false? stripIndent() can get rid of the extra space characters in "happy birthday".
backText: False. strip() only gets rid of whitespace from the ends of the string.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.069
frontText: Which sorts first: letters or numbers?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.070
frontText: What is the most restrictive access modifier?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.071
frontText: True or false? An instance method is allowed to reference a static variable.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.072
frontText: Write a static import to import the static LENGTH variable of a.b.C.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.073
frontText: True or false? Overloaded methods have the same method signatures.
backText: False. The parameter lists must be different.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.074
frontText: Which order does Java use when looking for matches in overloaded methods of: autoboxing, exact match, widening primitives, varargs?
backText: exact match, widening primitives, autoboxing, varargs

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.075
frontText: List all the access modifiers.
backText: public, private, protected, and package. The first three are keywords. The last is specified with the lack of a keyword.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.076
frontText: When is a return statement not required in a method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.077
frontText: What is wrong with public void method(String... s, int... b) {}?
backText: A vararg parameter must be the last parameter in a parameter list, and only one is allowed per method.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.078
frontText: What modifier can be used to prevent a method parameter from being reassigned?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.079
frontText: True or false? A static method is allowed to reference an instance variable.
backText: False (except through a reference to a class instance)

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.080
frontText: When passing an object to a method, how can the method be written to change the object that the caller references?
backText: It cannot. A method cannot directly change the reference the caller passes so that the caller sees the change.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.081
frontText: What must be the same for two methods to be considered overloaded?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.082
frontText: What is a final static variable commonly referred to as?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.083
frontText: Fill in the blank: An instance initializer can access _________ variables declared in the class.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.084
frontText: True or false? A vararg that takes a list of int values can be written within a method declaration using int... or int[].
backText: False. Only ... can be used to declare a vararg.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.085
frontText: What is unboxing?
backText: The process of converting a wrapper class into its equivalent primitive

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.086
frontText: True or false? If a method has an int return type and does not throw an exception, it must return a value.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.087
frontText: True or false? Objects in Java can inherit at most one class.
backText: False. While Java does rely on single inheritance, a class can extend another class, so a single class may inherit multiple classes.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.088
frontText: Which keyword(s) can be used to access a member of the parent class?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.089
frontText: List the order of class and instance initialization within a single class.
backText: static variable declarations, static initializers, instance variable declarations, instance initializers, constructors

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.090
frontText: True or false? The this() statement can be used to call other constructors within the class but can only be used on the first line of a constructor.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.091
frontText: Name the four rules an overridden method must follow.
backText: An overridden method must have the exact same signature, the same or a more accessible access modifier, and a covariant return type. It also must not throw a new or broader checked exception.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.092
frontText: Fill in the blank: A _______ class is the first non‐abstract class that extends an abstract class and is required to implement all inherited abstract methods.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.093
frontText: True or false? Polymorphism allows an object to be passed as a class it inherits but not an interface type.
backText: False. Polymorphism allows an object to be passed by any reference type that the class inherits.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.094
frontText: Which keyword(s) can be used to access a member declared within the class?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.095
frontText: True or false? An abstract class must contain at least one abstract method.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.096
frontText: Name two ways to prevent an immutable class from being extended by a mutable subclass.
backText: Mark the class final or make all of the constructors private.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.097
frontText: What return types are covariant with void?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.098
frontText: True or false? Abstract classes do not contain constructors.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.099
frontText: What should the instance variables of an immutable class be declared?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.100
frontText: Fill in the blank: An abstract method must be _______ in the first concrete subclass that inherits the method.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.101
frontText: Where can a call to super() or this() occur within a constructor?
backText: As the first statement of the constructor

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.102
frontText: How do you override a static method declared in a parent class?
backText: Trick question! Only instance methods can be overridden.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.103
frontText: True or false? A no‐argument constructor may only be inserted by the compiler.
backText: False. It can be explicitly declared.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.104
frontText: True or false? A class containing an abstract method must be marked abstract.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.105
frontText: Name the four types of nested classes.
backText: Inner class, static nested class, local class, and anonymous class

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.106
frontText: What modifiers are implicitly applied to all interface variables?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.107
frontText: True or false? An interface can extend multiple interfaces.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.108
frontText: What modifiers are implicitly applied to all interface methods without a body?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.109
frontText: What access modifiers can be applied to a member inner class?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.110
frontText: True or false? Records are both immutable and encapsulated.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.111
frontText: True or false? A class can implement two interfaces that have the same method signature.
backText: True, provided the methods are compatible using the rules for overridden methods

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.112
frontText: Under what circumstances can the extends clause of the subclass of a sealed class be omitted?
backText: Trick question! It cannot be omitted.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.113
frontText: True or false? A private static interface method can access a default interface method within the same interface.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.114
frontText: What is the purpose of sealing an interface?
backText: To restrict which interfaces can extend the interface or classes that can implement the interface

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.115
frontText: What is the result of extending a class marked final?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.116
frontText: What access modifiers are permitted for enum constructors?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.117
frontText: Given an interface Fly with no abstract methods, how would you create an instance of an anonymous class that implements it?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.118
frontText: Which elements are inserted by the compiler into a record declaration?
backText: A constructor, accessor methods, and useful implementations of equals(), hashCode(), and toString()

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.119
frontText: True or false? An anonymous class can only be declared as extending one class or implementing one interface.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.120
frontText: Given an outer class Rooster and its inner class Wattle, how would you create an instance of Wattle within an instance method of Rooster?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.121
frontText: Fill in the blank with explicit or implicit: Accessing an object by one of its supertypes can be done with an __________ cast.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.122
frontText: A sealed class most closely resembles what other top‐level type?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.123
frontText: Which characters in this statement are optional? () -> { System.out.println(); return true; }
backText: None. The parentheses are required when there aren’t any parameters. The braces are required because there are multiple statements.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.124
frontText: What functional interface does Java provide that declares a single method that returns a boolean?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.125
frontText: What aspects of the following statement are invalid? Consumer p = (p) -> {int var = 3; var++; return;};
backText: The p variable is reused inside the lambda expression. The rest of the statement is valid.

frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference given that a List is passed in: x -> x.isEmpty()

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.127
frontText: Which functional interface takes two parameters and returns a boolean?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.128
frontText: Which functional interface takes one parameter and returns a (possibly) different Object type?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.129
frontText: True or false? All method references can be rewritten as a lambda.
backText: True. A method reference is a short form of a lambda.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.130
frontText: True or false? If one lambda parameter uses var as the type, all other parameters in that lambda must as well.
backText: True. The type format must be consistent within a lambda.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.131
frontText: If an interface is annotated with @FunctionalInterface, what three common abstract methods can the interface declare in addition to the custom single abstract method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.132
frontText: Which functional interface is declared with two generics and has an apply() method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.133
frontText: What primitive has exactly one predefined functional interface?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.134
frontText: What method does DoubleBinaryOperator declare?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.135
frontText: Which functional interface converts from int to double?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.136
frontText: What does ObjectIntegerConsumer do?
backText: Nothing. This is not part of the Java API.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.137
frontText: What functional interfaces have andThen() as a helper method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.138
frontText: Which functional interface takes two parameters and has an accept() method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.139
frontText: What does the Collection removeIf() operation do, and what parameter does it take?
backText: The removeIf() operation takes a Predicate and removes all elements from a Collection for which the Predicate evaluates to true.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.140
frontText: What parameter type does Collection forEach() take?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.141
frontText: Assuming T is a generic type, fill in the blank to make this code compile so that the method returns the same type it is passed in: public static _________ returnObject(T o) { return o;}

frontText: What do FIFO and LIFO stand for, and what Java Collections Framework interface are they associated with?

frontText: What three methods taking a lambda as a parameter can you call directly on an ArrayList (without using a stream)?

frontText: What method do you need to implement in a Comparator, and how many parameters does it take?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.145
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface requires unique elements?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.146
frontText: Do lower or upper bounds allow you to add elements to a list?
backText: Lower bounds do because they specify the class that all types must be above using super.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.147
frontText: What will equals() return when comparing a List and Set with the same elements?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.148
frontText: True or false? Queue.of() returns an immutable list.
backText: False. This method does not exist.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.149
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface has an offerFirst() method?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.150
frontText: What Map method gives you all the keys?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.151
frontText: True or false? Arrays.asList() returns an immutable list.
backText: False. It returns a fixed‐sized list backed by an array.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.152
frontText: Does this compile? List<> l = new ArrayList();
backText: No. The diamond operator must be on the right side.

frontText: Which Collector creates a single String from a Stream?

frontText: How do you create an Optional with the value "hi"?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.167
frontText: True or false? The sorted() intermediate operation has overloaded versions that allow passing or omitting a Comparator.

frontText: When converting from an IntStream to a CharStream, what mapping method do you call?

frontText: What Collector would you use to return the type Map>?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.170
frontText: What Collector would you use to get the number of elements in a stream?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.171
frontText: What method can you call on IntStream to get the sum and average?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.172
frontText: What is the parent class for all exception types in Java?

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.173
frontText: Under what conditions may a resource created before a try‐with‐resources statement be used in a try‐with‐resources declaration?
backText: The resource must be marked final or effectively final.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.1.174
frontText: What is the difference between a checked and an unchecked exception?

frontText: What order do the class declarations, import statements, and package declaration go, in a file?
backText: The package declaration comes first, followed by imports, followed by the class declaration.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.003
frontText: True or false? Instance initializer blocks run before any constructors are initialized.
backText: True. Fields and instance initializer blocks are run first, in the order in which they appear, followed by any constructor calls.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.004
frontText: True or false? String is a primitive type.
backText: False. String is an object type, although Java has built‐in support for String literals.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.005
frontText: True or false? At runtime, it is possible to change the type of a var after it is declared.
backText: False. A var is initialized with a specific type.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.006
frontText: Which of the following variables can null be assigned to? String s; Object o; int num; boolean b
backText: String s and Object o can be assigned null because they are objects.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.007

backText: A letter, currency symbol ($), or underscore (_)

frontText: Fill in the blanks: When executing a jar command, _____ is used to specify the JAR should be created, while _____ is used to specify the directory used to create the JAR.
backText: Lowercase -c is used to specify that the JAR should be created, while uppercase -C is used to specify the directory used to create the JAR.

backText: Only 1_234 and 7_8.9_0 are valid literals. The other two have an underscore (_) next to a decimal or at the end of the value.

backText: It could produce side effects or unexpected results if the loop counter or condition is modified directly.

backText: False. They can also throw an exception.

frontText: Which type of loop can never be used inside another loop?
backText: Trick question. All loop types can be used inside each other.

backText: True, provided the flow scoping is valid

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.046

backText: Trick question! Traditional switch statements do not return a value.

backText: None. An else statement does not have a conditional clause.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.052
frontText: When calling a String.format() method, what is the meaning of the symbols %n and %d?
backText: The %n symbol is used to indicate a new line, while the %d symbol is used for integer values.

backText: hmm. The result of substring() is not stored anywhere, and strings are immutable, so s itself is not modified.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.067
frontText: True or false? stripIndent() can get rid of the extra space characters in "happy \\\\nbirthday".
backText: False. The whitespace here is at the end of the line, not the beginning.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.068

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.070
frontText: What is an effectively final variable?

backText: Return type, access modifier, and exception list may vary. If the method name were different, it would be a different method rather than an overloaded method.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.074

frontText: True or false? When autocommit mode is enabled, creating a savepoint throws an exception.

title: fc864585.JaSE17SG.2.257
